necklace@slott.name: Necklace
necklace@slott.examine:
The most beautiful peace of jewelry you ever have seen, and look at the size 
of that diamond that sits in the middle of it! This must be worth a fortune.

shield@slott.desc[1]:
You almost oversaw a dusty Shield in the corner, haven't it been for the 
light from the window you would never spotted it.
shield@slott.name: Shield
shield@slott.examine: A metal shield, this would offer you some protection?
shield@slott.desc[0]: A shield has been dropped here.

sandwich@slott.name: Sandwich
sandwich@slott.examine:
Yummie, a sandwich with all the good stuff on.  Ham, cheese, quecumbers, 
tomato and some sallad.
sandwich@slott.desc[0]: A freshly made sandwich lies here.

table3@slott.name: Table3
table3@slott.examine: You look at the table and notice that it has been used as a makeup table.

whip@slott.desc[1]: A whip hangs on the northern wall.
whip@slott.name: Whip
whip@slott.examine:
A large whip made of oxskin, this looks like it could be used both as a 
weapon and a rope.

benches@slott.name: Benches
benches@slott.examine: You look at the bench nearest the altar and you find a button.

drawer@slott.desc[1]: There is a drawer in the cupboard, it is closed.
drawer@slott.name: Drawer

bed@slott.name: Bed
bed@slott.examine: The largest oak bed you ever seen, looks really comfortable.

bowl@slott.desc[1]: A bowl has been placed here.
bowl@slott.name: Bowl
bowl@slott.examine: A sallads bowl, good to store things in.
bowl@slott.desc[0]: A bowl has been left here.

bag@slott.desc[1]: Something is sticking out of the manure!
bag@slott.name: Bag
bag@slott.examine: A bag, nice to store stuff in.
bag@slott.desc[0]: A bag has been dropped here .

krusefix@slott.name: Krusefix
krusefix@slott.examine: A standard Krusefix, with Jesus nailed to it.

diary@slott.name: Diary
diary@slott.examine:
This is the diary of the butler Manfred.
    The page you have look up is about what happened a dark night
    for many years ago. The night when the castle was over taken
    by the evil creature that you now is searching for.
    The butler has written down the following:
    'It was a dark and stormy autumn night when we first heard 
    an awful scream, it was the &+Rmrs&* of the house that had 
    Encountered the creature in the library. When I got there 
    she was gone. Then later that night the &+Rson&* and the 
    &+Rdoughter&* disappeared, now one has ever seen them again. 
    But every night when there is a fullmoon, the screams of the
    missing family members are heard echoing through the castle. 
    I have hidden my &+Rmaster&* in the northeast tower hoping 
    that the creature will not find him there. I don't know why
    the creature haven't taken me, couse I know it could have,
    I woke up one night and saw it standing in the doorway to 
    my room but it backed away from me when I stood up and was to
    jump it. I thought I could capture it and lock it inside the
    closet. &+YBut it ran away, as if I would SMELL bad or something&*.
    OH god if I was 30 years younger, I would have gone down into
    the basement to kill this horrible monster, but ack I'm to old
    and weakened to wield a sword nore less to hit with it. I'm 
    glad that I had the strength to destroy the stairs down to 
    the basement, preventing IT from coming up here again. Now 
    there is only &+Cone&* way left down there, but that way only 
    leads down &+bso the one who dares to go down might be stuck 
    &+bthere for ever&*! The way down is a &+Csecret passage&* that my 
    &+Rmaster&* only knows of and he won't reveal it to me, maybe 
    he's afraid that I would do something stupid.'
diary@slott.desc[0]: Someone has misplaced their diary here.

hole3@slott.name: Hole3
hole3@slott.examine: &+WEEWWW&*, gross. This is used as a toalett, and no one as cleaned it in a while.

altar@slott.name: Altar
altar@slott.examine:
There is a small note attached saying:  'Beware of the monster below.'
Sometime ago the altar was shifted from its base and put back again!  You
just can't figure out how someone could have moved this big chunk of stone!
altar@slott.desc[0]: An altar stands at the southern end of the room.

table@slott.name: Table
table@slott.examine: A small round table of oak, once very polished but now full of dust.

footlinks@slott.name: Footlinks
footlinks@slott.examine: A footlinks, the kind you chain people with.

shelf@slott.name: Shelf
shelf@slott.examine:
A shelf, probably where they stored the hats and gloves for the castle 
visitors.  Empty now though.

window2@slott.name: Window2
window2@slott.examine:
This is huge, the window is facing the front yard. You see the stables, 
and you see there is a way leading off to the east behind the stables.

bathtub@slott.name: Bathtub
bathtub@slott.examine: Wow this is big, could easily get 4-5 persons down in it.

candle@slott.desc[1]: A candle stands on one of the tables.
candle@slott.name: Candle
candle@slott.examine: An old wax candle, this might come in good use.
candle@slott.desc[0]: A candle has been dropped here.

outsidedoor3@slott.desc[1]: There is a panel in the wall.
outsidedoor3@slott.name: outsidedoor3
outsidedoor3@slott.examine: Looks like it could be pushed!

windows@slott.name: Windows
windows@slott.examine:
You look out through the windows and see a once beautiful garden.  
Now it's overgrown with grass, what a pity!

note@slott.desc[1]: A small note lies on the table.
note@slott.name: Note
note@slott.examine:
&+CThe note seems to be written by the lord of the house, and it reads:

'I fear for my familie lives, so I have barrikaded myself on the 
secondfloor, waiting for some help from the outside. My dear family has 
been taken by the evil that haunts the house. Help me free my family and 
I will richly reward you. find a way to trapp the evil creatur that lives 
in the darkest holes! But beware, one mistake can trapp you down in the 
dark forever....
		    
Ps: The only one that don't seems to be affected is my butler, and he is 
to cowered to enter the dark place where the evil lurks. We don't know why 
he's mot affected by this evil creature but maybe you can find out the 
secret he carries on..'

hole2@slott.name: Hole2
hole2@slott.examine:
As you look up in the hole you see what is left of the stairs, high above 
your head two metal &+Brods&* are sticking out of the walls.

key@slott.desc[1]: A small key lies on a table.
key@slott.name: Key
key@slott.examine: Just a key, what did you suspect?
key@slott.desc[0]: A small key has been dropped here.

woddenbowl@slott.name: Woddenbowl
woddenbowl@slott.examine: A woddenbowl to have fruits in.
woddenbowl@slott.desc[0]: A woddenbowl stands on the table.

sign@slott.name: Sign
sign@slott.examine:
_______________________________
                 |   Beware of the being, that   |
                 | lurks the dark underground!! _|
   	         | couse if you aren't cousius,/
	         |  you will be captured do.. /
	          \__________________________/
		     The note has been torn apart
		     so the last part is missing...
sign@slott.desc[0]: A old worn sign is nailed to the front doors of the castle.

box@slott.desc[1]: There is a closed box on the table.
box@slott.name: Box
box@slott.examine: A red box with &+ygold&* painted roses on it.
box@slott.desc[0]: The jewlery box has been opened.

hook@slott.name: Hook
hook@slott.examine: A hook to hang up coats and rocks on!

cupboards2@slott.name: Cupboards2
cupboards2@slott.examine: A small cupboard stand beside the bed.

table2@slott.name: Table2
table2@slott.examine: A large table made of oak, it is set for six persons.

garlics@slott.name: Garlics
garlics@slott.desc[0]: A garlic has been dropped here.

bench_button@slott.name: bench_button
bench_button@slott.desc[0]: The altar has shifted from its base exposing a secret passage!

books@slott.name: Books
books@slott.examine:
You open the book to the first page and read:

TELL ME, O MUSE, of that ingenious hero who traveled far and wide after he 
had sacked the famous town of Troy. Many cities did he visit, and many were 
the nations with whose manners and customs he was acquainted; moreover he 
suffered much by sea while trying to save his own life and bring his men 
safely home; but do what he might he could not save his men, for they 
perished through their own sheer folly in eating the cattle of the Sun-god 
Hyperion; so the god prevented them from ever reaching home. Tell me, too, 
about all these things, O daughter of Jove, from what so ever source you 
may know them.
		    
Hmm looks like the first book of Homer's Odyssey, wonder how that got here...

coat@slott.desc[1]: A coat hangs here on a hook.
coat@slott.name: Coat
coat@slott.desc[0]: A coat lies on the ground.

stove@slott.name: Stove
stove@slott.examine: The stove has been recently used and is still warm.

hole@slott.name: Hole
hole@slott.examine:
Looking down the hole you see what is left of the stairs, the stone and 
wood rubble. Down below looks treacherous and you don't even want to know 
what would happen if you fell down there. It's too dark to see anything of 
the rest of the room!
hole@slott.desc[0]: There is a rope tied here leading to the lower level.

knife@slott.desc[1]: There is an small knife on the table.
knife@slott.name: Knife
knife@slott.examine: A small knife, it's sharp so watch your fingers.

ring@slott.name: Ring
ring@slott.examine: This ring glows of an magic power, you never seen before!

portraits@slott.name: Portraits
portraits@slott.examine:
The family portraits have the oldest to the south and the youngest to 
the north. The northern portrait catches your attention, it's portraying 
a young man sitting in a chapel of some kind, in each hand he's got a big 
garlic, wonder why?

rods2@slott.name: Rods2
rods2@slott.desc[0]: You see a rope hanging downward, but its just out of reach.

door@slott.name: Door
door@slott.examine: The door has not used in a long time.

cupboards@slott.name: Cupboards
cupboards@slott.examine: A cupboard stands against the wall.

insidedoor3@slott.desc[1]: A shelf stands against the wall.
insidedoor3@slott.name: insidedoor3
insidedoor3@slott.examine: By the marks in the dust on the floor this shelf serves as a door!
insidedoor3@slott.desc[0]: The shelf has been pushed aside.

rods@slott.name: Rods
rods@slott.examine:
Looks like it's should hold for a person to hang onto! Could be a good 
place to fasten a rope or something! If you just could throw it up there, 
you might just be able to climb up!!
rods@slott.desc[0]:
A rope is snagged on a metal rod, allowing you to climb up but just barely.
Climbing back down however is too risky.

woodpiece@slott.desc[1]: A piece of a wood door lies here.
woodpiece@slott.name: Woodpiece
woodpiece@slott.examine: Looks like a piece of a closet door.
woodpiece@slott.desc[0]: A burning piece of wood is here.

closet@slott.name: Closet
closet@slott.examine: A closet, not that big but still a closet.

carpet@slott.name: Carpet
carpet@slott.examine:
You examine the pink carpet and finds some blood traces in one of the corner 
of the room, this must have been where the girl was when she was taken by 
the creature.

orange@slott.name: Orange
orange@slott.desc[0]: A delicious orange has been dropped here.

slott49@slott.title: Behind the stable
slott49@slott.description:
EEWW what a smell! This is where they have shoveled out the horse manure 
from the stable.  And it's not a pretty sight...

slott33@slott.title: Hallway
slott33@slott.description:
This hallway is dark and dim, in a strange way. Course it should be more 
enlightened--the whole eastern wall is full with windows and the sun is shining 
on the western wall. It looks like the wall soaks in all the light that hits it.

slott37@slott.title: Corridor
slott37@slott.description:
This is a corridor that runs at the north side of the castle, connecting 
the different bedrooms to gather. The corridor continues to the &+Cwest&* and 
the &+Ceast&*.

slott11@slott.title: The kitchen
slott11@slott.description:
The kitchen is large, large enough for several cooks to work here at the 
same time. There is a big &+Bstove&* placed in the middle of the room, the 
walls are filled with &+Bcupboards&* and &+Bdrawers&*. You notice that this 
room has been used recently, there is no dust or filth anywhere.

slott38@slott.title: End of corridor
slott38@slott.description:
This is one end of an corridor leading to the &+Ceast&*. The walls are clean, 
not even a painting or a drape hangs here.

slott27@slott.title: SW tower
slott27@slott.description:
You have entered the southwest tower. There is not much to see in here 
except the stairs leading &+Cdown&* and the doorway to the &+Cnorth&*.

slott13@slott.title: Hallway
slott13@slott.description:
This is a hallway that reaches from north to the south.  The walls in 
this room are clean, but you can see that there had been paintings hanging 
here.  Wonder where they are now?  The hallway continues to the &+Csouth&*.

slott22@slott.title: Hallway
slott22@slott.description:
The hallway ends abruptly, the ceiling has caved in blocking the doors 
to the east. As you examine what's left of the ceiling you see some marks 
as if someone has used a big sledgehammer on it. And you start to think that 
the ceiling has been deliberately made to cave in, just as if someone wouldn't 
let someone in or OUT.

slott39@slott.title: NW tower
slott39@slott.description:
This is the northwest tower, the only thing in here accept the dust is a 
stair leading &+Cdown&*.

slott8@slott.title: Storage room
slott8@slott.description:
You are standing in a small room that once was used as a storage room, 
but now there is only rubbage left. You can't see anything that could be 
useful to you.

slott25@slott.title: Bathroom
slott25@slott.description:
This is the castle bathroom, filled with the usual stuff you need for 
personal hygiene...soap, toothpaste, etc. and of course a bucket of water. 
There is a large &+Bbathtub&* at the southern wall and a strange &+Bhole&* in the 
floor at the west wall.

slott24@slott.title: Upperhall
slott24@slott.description:
As you enter this room the first thing you notice is the big &+Bwindow&* 
in the southern wall.  This used to be a peaceful room but someone tore the 
furniture apart and left them on the floor.

slott3@slott.title: In the hall
slott3@slott.description:
You stand in the hall of the castle. It is furnished with a small table 
and chairs. On the floor there lies a thick carpet. The ceilings were painted 
white a long time ago, but have turned yellow with age. There are grand stairs 
leading &+Cup&*, and doorways to the &+Cwest&* and &+Ceast&*

slott31@slott.title: The Son's bedroom
slott31@slott.description:
This used to be the Son's bedroom; now there is not much left in here. 
There is a small bed and some closets but other than that it has been cleaned 
out for some reason. There would have been toys and things like that but there 
is not a trace of them.

slott15@slott.title: Library
slott15@slott.description:
This is a large library with bookcases full of books.  There are small 
tables and chairs placed out tastefully so people should be able to sit and 
read in peace. On the western wall there is a large fireplace.

slott42@slott.title: Basement
slott42@slott.description:
This is a small corridor leading to the &+Cwest&* and to the &+Ceast&*. The 
air is so thick in here that you almost could cut it with your knife.

slott16@slott.title: Innerhall
slott16@slott.description:
This hall seperates the servants' area from the rest of the house. There 
are some small chairs and smaller tables here, this must been where the 
servants where sitting when they where on duty but didn't had anything to do 
for the moment.

slott1@slott.title: The Yard
slott1@slott.description:
You are standing in a large yard surrounded by high fences. To the &+Cnorth&* 
you see the entry to a castle, and to the &+Ceast&* you see a small stable.  The
murky swampland can be seen below.

slott6@slott.title: Southeast tower
slott6@slott.description:
You find yourself in a round room, as you look around you can see by the 
dust and dirt that this room hasn't been in use for a long time. This is one 
of the corner towers of the castle. Spiral stairs head &+Cup&*.

slott48@slott.title: The path turns...
slott48@slott.description:
Here the path does a turn around the tower.  And you smell something 
resembling horse manure.

slott20@slott.title: Hallway
slott20@slott.description: A hallway, leading off to the &+Ceast&* and &+Csouth&*.

slott41@slott.title: Basement
slott41@slott.description:
You find yourself standing in a small room. This room had been bigger but 
now the west wall has collapsed and taken the stairs with it, the only trace 
left of the stairs is that &+Bhole&* in the ceiling.

slott36@slott.title: End of corridor
slott36@slott.description:
This is one end of a corridor; there are doorways in all directions. This 
must be the cleanest room in the castle, not as much as a trace of dust and 
dirt is to be found anywhere. Even the ceiling looks like it have been cleaned 
recently!

slott28@slott.title: SE tower
slott28@slott.description:
This is the southeast tower...or what's left of it. The eastern wall and 
parts of the roof are gone; it had been struck by lightning and crumbled to 
the ground. As you look out where the wall once stood, you see a small garden 
path under the mess that the stones and wood from the tower has created.

slott44@slott.title: Coffin
slott44@slott.description:
A coffin, bigger then the average coffin. But nonetheless just a wooden 
coffin, the type you use to bury people in.

slott18@slott.title: Backyard
slott18@slott.description:
The backyard is filled with garbage, piles of decomposed food, old 
clothes, broken furniture, and a lot of stuff that you can't recognize. 
The smell is awful and you wonder why nobody has cleaned this mess up.

slott14@slott.title: Dinner Room
slott14@slott.description:
This is where the family of the house eats their dinner. The room is big 
and in the middle there is a large &+Btable&* with six chairs around it.  
Along the walls there are a few cupboards and benches. The air smells of food, 
and your stomach starts to rumble.

slott23@slott.title: Northeast tower
slott23@slott.description:
You find yourself in a dark moist tower room. There is a &+Bdoor&* in the 
western wall. Everything in here is covered with a thick layer of dust! And 
the only thing in here besides the door is stairs leading &+Cup&*.

slott35@slott.title: The masters hideout
slott35@slott.description:
This room is comfortably furnished with a small bed, a table and some 
chairs. It almost looks like a prison cell, just more comfortable. This is 
the room that the butler has prepared for his master, and a good job it is. 
This is the kind of room you would like to have if you were locked away for 
a long time.

slott9@slott.title: Servant quarters
slott9@slott.description:
This is a rather large room with beds, shelves and cupboards. This is 
where the servants spend their time when they are off duty, now there 
hasn't been anyone in here for a long time. Dust covers everything and 
the beds don't look especially inviting.

slott12@slott.title: Hallway
slott12@slott.description:
This is a hallway that reaches from south to the north. The eastern walls 
are filled with &+Bportraits&* and on the western walls there are &+Bwindows&*. 
The hallway continues to the &+Cnorth&*.

slott21@slott.title: Hallway
slott21@slott.description:
The walls are covered with old paintings of a beautiful garden. They 
are from different seasons; winter, summer, autumn but you can't find one 
with a spring motive. You wonder why, isn't the spring one of the 
prettiest seasons?

slott30@slott.title: Mrs's bedroom
slott30@slott.description:
This was once a beautiful bedroom with a big comfortable &+Bbed&* and a 
small &+Btable&* at the eastern wall. There are some closets in here but 
they have been raided by someone...someone that didn't care much of doors 
apparently, course a few of them have been torn apart or the doors have been 
smashed to tiny pieces!

slott7@slott.title: Southwest tower
slott7@slott.description:
You find yourself on the bottom floor of an tower. This is one of the 
corner towers of the castle. Spiral stairs head &+Cup&*.

slott46@slott.title: Garden path
slott46@slott.description:
This is a garden path leading off to the &+Csouth&* and &+Cnorth&*. The sides 
of the path were once covered with flowers that were treated by loving and 
tendering hands, but now they have grown wild and spread themselves all over 
the lawn and into the grovel path.

slott17@slott.title: Backhall
slott17@slott.description:
This is the servants' entrance to the castle, this room is Spartan 
furnished with small benches and hooks on the walls to hang up their outdoor 
clothes. The door in the eastern wall has been forced of it's hinges and 
lies outside on the stairs, looking out through the hole where the door's 
used to be you see a backyard!

slott50@slott.title: &+RThe Hole...&*
slott50@slott.description:
You jumped down into the hole but...

<<<<<<< Splat! >>>>>>>

Oh my! Looks like you have died!

slott4@slott.title: The closet
slott4@slott.description:
This is apparently where the guests' rocks and hats were hung when they 
arrived to the castle. There are several &+Bshelves&* and &+Bhooks&* in here.

slott10@slott.title: Family Sanctuary
slott10@slott.description:
You have entered the sacred temple of the castle. Here the family of the 
house say their prayers. Now it hasn't been used for a long time and dust 
covers everything! But you can still see the &+Bkrusefix&* on the wall, and 
the paintings pretending the almighty God and his son Jesus. There are also 
some church &+Bbenches&* here.

slott29@slott.title: Crossway
slott29@slott.description: This is a small corridor leading to the &+Cnorth, &+Csouth&* and to the &+Ceast&*.

slott26@slott.title: Manfreds bedroom
slott26@slott.description:
This is a small bedroom, there is a small bed, a &+Bcupboard&*, and a small 
&+Bcloset&* in here. This is the bedroom of the butler; he must really be doing 
his job well to have his own room.

slott43@slott.title: Here be evil...
slott43@slott.description:
This room is even darker then the rest of the basement, and in the dim 
light you see a large coffin standing against the northern wall. At the 
eastern end of the room you see some &+Bfootlinks&* that are fastened to the 
floor. The western wall is filled with paintings, many of them are of 
landscapes painted in the spring.

slott45@slott.title: Old storage room
slott45@slott.description:
As you walk into this room, the first thing you notice are the big piles 
of stuff that lie in here. Someone has used this room to store everything 
in it. You see &+Bbooks&*, clothes, kitchen stuff like pots and pans, a sofa, 
chairs, tables and a lot of plain garbage.

slott19@slott.title: Northwest Tower
slott19@slott.description:
You entered a round tower like room, and the first you notice is a 
&+Bhole&* in the floor, looks like the stairs down have caved in. But 
the stairs leading &+Cup&* are still in good shape.

slott2@slott.title: The Stable
slott2@slott.description:
You find yourself in an old stable; there are no horses in here.  But the 
floors are newly cleaned and the air vibrates with the smell of horses, so 
it seems like it is in full use.

slott40@slott.title: Basement
slott40@slott.description:
The room is cold and dim, the walls absorbs the light almost completely. 
The air could have been better, but at least it's breathable!

slott47@slott.title: Garden path
slott47@slott.description:
The garden path continues the &+Csouth&* and to the &+Cnorth&*. Here big rocks 
and wood pieces fill the path, and as you look up at the castle tower you see 
why. The tower had been struck by lightning and the whole eastern wall and a 
pretty big part of the roof have fallen down to where you stand now.

slott5@slott.title: Ballroom
slott5@slott.description:
You have entered a huge ballroom with crystal chandeliers and small oak 
&+Btables&*. Chairs are placed at the sides leaving the floor in the middle open 
for dancing. There are several paintings on the walls, one of which especially 
draws your attention. It pretends a young man battling against a big man 
with a blurred face only with his hands...as you look closer you see that 
he's got a big &+wwhite&* union between his teeth! Wonder why?

slott34@slott.title: Hallway
slott34@slott.description:
This room is pitch black. The only vague light is coming from the &+Cwest&* 
and &+Csouth&*.

slott32@slott.title: Daughter's bedroom
slott32@slott.description:
You have entered a typical teenaged girls room, most things in here 
are pink, such as the blanket on the bed, the drapes on the walls and even the 
thick &+Bcarpet&* that lies on the floor.

housemaster@slott.name: HouseMaster
housemaster@slott.examine:
This is the master of the castle! He is an old and weak man, it looks like 
he hasn't seen the sun for a long time. His skin is white and long grey 
hair is in need for a bath and a trim. He looks to be a wise and kind man!
housemaster@slott.description: &+RThe Master&* is standing in the middle of the room!

redcap3@slott.name: REDCAP3
redcap3@slott.examine:
This is a short, stocky old man with long gray hair and claws instead of 
hands! He loves to inhabit ancient ruins of castles, especially in those 
with a bloody history of war or murder! He wears a red hat, which is colored 
by the &+rblood&* of his victims. He also moves with remarkable speed, despite 
the fact that he wears iron boots!
redcap3@slott.description: &+RRed Cap&* is here, glowing of evil!

stableboy@slott.name: stableboy
stableboy@slott.examine: You see a very dirty young man, with a strange look in his eyes.
stableboy@slott.description: The &+RStableboy&* stands here, staring into nothing!

redcap5@slott.name: REDCAP5
redcap5@slott.examine:
This is a short, stocky old man with long gray hair and claws instead of 
hands! He loves to inhabit ancient ruins of castles, especially in those 
with a bloody history of war or murder! He wears a red hat, which is colored 
by the &+rblood&* of his victims. He also moves with remarkable speed, despite 
the fact that he wears iron boots!
redcap5@slott.description: &+RRed Cap&* is here, glowing of evil!

redcap2@slott.name: REDCAP2
redcap2@slott.examine:
This is a short, stocky old man with long gray hair and claws instead of 
hands! He loves to inhabit ancient ruins of castles, especially in those 
with a bloody history of war or murder! He wears a red hat, which is colored 
by the &+rblood&* of his victims. He also moves with remarkable speed, despite 
the fact that he wears iron boots!
redcap2@slott.description: &+RRed Cap&* is here, glowing of evil!

william@slott.name: William
william@slott.examine: William stares back at you, as if he would be afraid you wanted the sandwich.
william@slott.description: &+RWilliam the cook&* is here, making a sandwich!

family@slott.name: Family
family@slott.examine:
This is the rest of the family of the castle! Standing from the left, 
mother, son and daughter.

manfred@slott.name: Manfred
manfred@slott.examine:
As you look at Manfred you have to back away several steps.
PHEEW, he stinks of garlic, he has to have eaten a dozen of them.
manfred@slott.description: &+RManfred&* the butler stands here, wondering about who you are!

muryan@slott.name: Muryan
muryan@slott.examine:
You are looking at a soul of an ancient heathen that has been captured 
between worlds.  Course he is too good for &+Rhell&* and too bad for &+Yheaven&*! 
So he settled down in this castle instead, but got bored with the loneliness, 
so he kidnapped the Family to get some company, and he will not let them go, 
he'd rather kill them first!
muryan@slott.description: &+RMuryan stands here, giving you a chill down you spinalcord!
